Description: The FHIR List resource defines a collection of records that can be used within many places. We support direct reading of the List resource to give access to Patient Lists. Reading is supported for those types of lists and system lists.
SampleResponse:
<List xmlns="http://hl7.org/fhir">

<id value="eFUHrrnHAFB.u0iyC.m1fyvsg0tL5hWteKjITYhphT5Y3" />

<status value="current" />

<mode value="working" />

<title value="FHIR Example" />

<code>

<text value="PatientList" />

</code>

<date value="2018-03-26T15:54:40Z" />

<entry>

<item>

<reference value="https://vs-icx.epic.com:443/Interconnect-CDE/api/FHIR/STU3/Patient/ebhWlDzYDQnUWQCZXvHfXOg3" />

<display value="Life, Fhir" />

</item>

</entry>

<entry>

<item>

<reference value="https://vs-icx.epic.com:443/Interconnect-CDE/api/FHIR/STU3/Patient/eLTuGLDEzqBaWCfif.2RFig3" />

<display value="FHIR, Patient, PhD" />

</item>

</entry>

</List>

List.Name: List
List.Description: An instance of the STU3 List resource

emptyReason.Name: emptyReason
emptyReason.Description: The reason the list is empty. If the list returns no data, value is "nilknown".

display.Name: display
display.Description: Populating this field with the patient's name if the patient is not restricted or confidential to the user.

reference.Name: reference
reference.Description: The literal reference to the patient.

mode.Name: mode
mode.Description: The processing mode that applies to this list. Always "working". Values can be found here.

status.Name: status
status.Description: Status of the patient list. Always "current". Values can be found here.

title.Name: title
title.Description: The descriptive name for the list.
